record.dc:title: 271RE8 Montgomery Site 73RE8, Roane Co., TN. Feature 3, Circular stone box with top stone removed. Note partial use of bottom slabs. Earth under is burnt red and shows some charring. This could have been a crematory basin although no evidence of bone. Square 37R9. Direction northeast.
record.wpa:narrative: This stone box looked like the circular stone cist reported by Harrington - a burial was expected; however no bone, nor any sign of any was found and no hint as to the use of this feature was discernable. The bottom of the box was partially covered by flat limestone rocks. Throughout the center, a slightly burnt subsoil earth showed. The bottom rocks showed no signs of having been burnt.
record.wpa:comments: Observer illustration on file at the institution. See also photograph 270RE8 [fhm01526].
